title: Panamanian President gives major reality check to Trump over China operates Panama Canal claim: ‘Whole world is free…' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Panamanian President José Raúl Mulino gives major reality check to Trump over China operates Panama Canal claim: ‘Whole world is free…'

Date: December 29, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Panamanian President José Raúl Mulino dismissed US President-elect Donald Trump's accusation of Chinese troops operating the Panama Canal as unfounded.

  • President Mulino called Trump's claims "nonsense" and stressed that there is currently no Chinese presence in the canal.
  • Mulino emphasized the canal's Panamanian ownership and independence, stating it is not up for negotiation.
  • He highlighted the respectful diplomatic relationship between Panama and China established after severing ties with Taiwan in 2017.
  • Trump's comments were made during a social media post and at a conference where he expressed grievances over Panama's fees.
  • Mulino asserted the sovereignty of Panama, countering Trump’s threats to seize control of the canal.
“There is not a single Chinese soldier in the canal. For the love of God, you are free, the whole world is free, to visit the canal if you please.” - José Raúl Mulino

This incident highlights ongoing tensions in U.S.-Latin America relations, particularly concerning U.S. accusations regarding China's involvement in the region.
newTitle: Panamanian President Responds to Trump's Allegations About the Panama Canal

title: South Korea plane crash live: Only 65 victims of plane crash identified - Hindustan Times
summary:
South Korea Plane Crash: 65 Victims Identified Amid National Mourning

Date: December 29, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The Jeju Air flight 7C2216 crashed during landing in Muan, resulting in the deaths of 179 out of 181 passengers. Only two flight attendants survived the horrific accident.

  • The plane was returning from Bangkok with 175 passengers and six crew members.
  • The South Korean government has declared seven days of national mourning for the victims.
  • Widespread condolences have been offered from international leaders, including Pope Francis and the German Chancellor.
  • Five of the deceased were children under ten, with the youngest being just three years old.
  • The crash is the deadliest air disaster in South Korean history since 1997.
“I believe no words of consolation would suffice for the bereaved families who have suffered this tragedy,” - South Korea's acting President Choi Sang-mok.

This tragic event is a somber reminder of the vulnerabilities involved in air travel, prompting a thorough investigation into the causes to prevent future incidents.
newTitle: South Korea Plane Crash: 65 Victims Identified Amid National Mourning

title: South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates: Seven day national mourning declared till Jan 4 - The Indian Express
summary:
South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates

Date & Source: December 24, 2024, Indian Express

In an emergency meeting on Sunday, South Korea’s acting President Choi Sang-mok declared a national mourning period until January 4 following the deadly plane crash at Muan International Airport that killed 179. All on board except two crew members are feared dead as a plane carrying 181 passengers and six crew on a flight from Bangkok crashed and burst into flames early Sunday.

The crash site has been declared a special disaster zone.

  • A Jeju Air flight veered off the runway while landing and exploded into flames.
  • The airline is gathering information regarding the casualties and causes of the accident.
  • Two Thai nationals were among the 175 passengers, with the rest believed to be South Koreans.
“The government would like to offer its sincere condolences to the bereaved families and will do its best to recover from this accident and prevent a recurrence.” - Choi Sang-mok

This tragic incident has raised significant concerns regarding aviation safety measures in South Korea.
newTitle: South Korea Plane Crash Live Updates: National Mourning Declared

summary:
Azerbaijan President Claims Plane Crash Caused by Gunfire from Russia

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Azerbaijan State Television

The Azerbaijan Airlines plane crash in Kazakhstan, which killed 38 people, was allegedly caused by gunfire from Russian territory, according to Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev. He has called for Russia to acknowledge its role in the incident.

Key Points:

  • The plane was shot at from the ground in Russia, damaging it and leading to its crash.
  • President Aliyev accused Russia of trying to conceal the truth about the crash.
  • Putin offered an apology but did not confirm that Russian fire was responsible.
  • Azerbaijan has demanded accountability and an investigation into the crash.
  • Survivors reported hearing three blast sounds before the crash.
“Therefore, admitting the guilt, apologizing in a timely manner to Azerbaijan, which is considered a friendly country, and informing the public about this - all these were measures and steps that should have been taken.” - Ilham Aliyev

This incident has raised significant tensions between Azerbaijan and Russia, with implications for their diplomatic relations.

Day 4 of the Boxing Day Test saw Jasprit Bumrah lead India's bowling attack with a remarkable performance, claiming his 200th Test wicket. However, Australia managed to hold steady with crucial contributions from their lower order, leaving the match delicately poised heading into the final day.

  • Jasprit Bumrah took 4 wickets for 56 runs, reaching a milestone of 200 Test wickets.
  • Australia ended the day at 228/9, leading by 333 runs.
  • Marnus Labuschagne scored 70 runs, while Pat Cummins contributed 41 runs.
  • A frustrating last-wicket stand of 55 runs between Nathan Lyon and Scott Boland was instrumental.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal dropped three crucial catches, affecting India's chances.
“Bumrah reached the remarkable milestone in just his 44th Test, making him the fastest Indian pacer to achieve this feat.”

The match remains finely balanced with all four results still possible. The final day will prove crucial as India attempts to chase down Australia’s lead.

summary:
Amsterdam-bound passenger jet skids off runway after emergency landing in Norway

Published on: Dec 29, 2024 By: Devika Bhattacharya

A KLM Royal Dutch Airlines flight heading to Amsterdam from Oslo encountered a hydraulic failure shortly after takeoff, necessitating an emergency landing at Sandefjord Airport.

  • The Boeing 737-800 was carrying 182 people, all of whom were unharmed.
  • The crew diverted to Sandefjord Airport, located approximately 110 kilometers south of Oslo.
  • The aircraft touched down safely but lost control after landing, skidding off runway 18.
  • Authorities have commenced an investigation into the incident, and recovery efforts temporarily disrupted airport operations.

KLM flight #KL1204, a Boeing 737-800, veered off the right side of runway 18 after landing at Oslo Torp Sandefjord Airport.

The incident did not result in any injuries, and passengers were evacuated safely as emergency crews arrived.

title: Year 2024 ends on bad note for Boeing with twin disasters striking 737-800 aircraft on same day - Telangana Today
summary:
Boeing Faces Turbulence: Two 737-800 Disasters Reported on Same Day

Published Date: 29 December 2024, 09:21 AM | Source: Telangana Today

The year 2024 ends on a distressing note for Boeing as two of its 737-800 aircraft were involved in separate accidents on the same day, resulting in 47 fatalities and prompting concerns over the safety of their operations.

  • First incident involved KLM flight KL1204, which successfully landed but skidded off the runway in Norway, causing no injuries among the 182 aboard.
  • The second incident occurred with Jeju Airlines flight 2216 in South Korea, leading to 47 deaths due to a crash landing.
  • Initial reports suggested a landing gear failure, but a possible bird strike may have also contributed to the disaster.
  • Boeing's future is now uncertain as investigations are underway to assess the safety of its 737-800 model.
"2024 is sure to leave Boeing extremely worried."

This unfortunate series of events raises pressing concerns regarding Boeing's aircraft safety and may have long-lasting implications for the airline industry.
newTitle: Boeing Faces Turbulence: Two 737-800 Disasters Reported on Same Day
